name: google-calendar
description: MCP server for Google Calendar integration. Creates calendar events for sprint boundaries, milestones, ceremonies, and deadline reminders. Used by the Scheduler and Integration Planner to map the project timeline to a shared calendar.

tools.name: create_event
tools.description: Create a calendar event with title, start/end time, description, attendees, and reminders

tools.name: create_all_day_event
tools.description: Create an all-day event for milestones and sprint boundaries

tools.name: create_recurring_event
tools.description: Create a recurring event for ceremonies (daily standups, weekly syncs, sprint reviews)

tools.name: list_events
tools.description: List existing events in a date range to avoid conflicts when scheduling

tools.name: update_event
tools.description: Update an existing event's details (time, description, attendees)

tools.name: delete_event
tools.description: Remove an event if the schedule is revised during planning

use_cases: Create all-day events for sprint or cycle start and end dates
Create milestone events with descriptions of expected deliverables
Schedule recurring ceremony events (daily standups, sprint reviews, retrospectives)
Set deadline reminder events one week before major milestones
Create stakeholder review meeting events at the configured reporting cadence
Block time for PI Planning, kickoffs, or other framework-specific events
team_integration: The Scheduler prepares calendar event data in Phase 5. The Integration Planner exports these events to Google Calendar in Phase 7, running in parallel with the Coordinator's final review. Events include sprint boundaries (all-day), milestones (all-day with description), recurring ceremonies (per framework), and reminder events (1 week before milestones). The calendar ID is read from CONFIG.local.md or the GOOGLE_CALENDAR_ID environment variable.

GOOGLE_CALENDAR_TOKEN.description: OAuth2 token for Google Calendar API access
GOOGLE_CALENDAR_TOKEN.how_to_get: Google Cloud Console > APIs & Services > Credentials > Create OAuth client ID > Authorize calendar scope

GOOGLE_CALENDAR_ID.description: Target calendar ID for event creation
GOOGLE_CALENDAR_ID.how_to_get: Google Calendar > Settings > Calendar ID (use 'primary' for the default calendar)
